description:
The Wen Clan's rampage caused untold sufferings, and the other cultivation clans launched the "Sunshot Campaign" to join forces against the Wen Clan. Although Wei Wuxian, the Yiling Patriarch, had made great contributions to overthrowing the Wens, he was stigmatized and punished because he was considered too powerful and dangerous. He was persecuted by ten thousand people.

Thirteen years later, Wei Wuxian has been brought back by a sacrificial ritual and has met again with old acquaintances such as Lan Wangji from the Gusu Lan Clan and Jiang Cheng from the Yunmeng Jiang Clan. The mysteries of Wei Wuxian's past remain, and conflicts in the cultivation world have resurfaced - all of which began from when they were all once youths.

(Source: QQ, translated)

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Wuxia
tags.description: Chinese fiction concerning the adventures of martial artists in Ancient China.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

node.description:
__[Website](https://civi-l-ian.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CIVILIAN_LyuLyu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/civilian_official/) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/koyama_nanou)__

__Introduction:__
Civilian, previously known as Lyu:Lyu and -itsuka-, is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record labels Sony Records (2016–), SPACE SHOWER MUSIC (2013–) and coolism records (2009–), having previously been under Eustoma Records (2016).

__Biography:__
The band was formed by classmates Hidekazu Koyama, Junichi Katou and Kiyoyuki Arita in 2008 under the name -itsuka-, they changed their name to Lyu:Lyu in 2009, and changed their name once again on July 18, 2016 to CIVILIAN.

__Members:__
- [Hidekazu Koyama](https://anilist.co/staff/177198/Hidekazu-Koyama) (小山秀和, コヤマヒデカズ) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Junichi Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/177200/Junichi-Katou) (加藤純市), better known by stage name Junichi (純市, じゅんいち) – bassist, also helps with composition and arrangement
- [Kiyoyuki Arita](https://anilist.co/staff/177199/Kiyoyuki-Arita) (有田清幸, ありたきよゆき) – drummer, also helps with composition and arrangement

[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.

title.native: 天宝伏妖录 第二季
